words.verbal-illustration: the protestors were unfazed by the prospect of arrest

words.definition: a child who behaves very badly : an annoying child
words.verbal-illustration: a bunch of ill-mannered little brats

words.definition: feeling or displaying no fear by temperament
words.verbal-illustration: undaunted despite their repeated failures at starting a business
I was cross with her for being so careless

words.definition: to cause someone to be worried or upset
words.verbal-illustration: It perturbed him that his son was thinking about leaving school

words.definition: to look through (as a place) carefully or thoroughly in an effort to find or discover something
words.verbal-illustration: the owner of the bed-and-breakfast often trolls antique stores for furniture and knickknacks
everyone scurried back to work as soon as they had finished their lunch in the cafeteria
if you continue to dawdle, we'll be late for sure
